message: Hello Bob, I have a great product that I think you'll love. I'm willing to sell it to you for $200. It's a great deal, and I think you won't find a better price anywhere else.
I'm interested in the product, but $200 is a bit steep for me. I'm willing to pay $120 for it.
I understand you're looking for a better price, but I'm not willing to go as low as $120. I'm willing to meet you halfway at $180. It's a fair price for a great product like this.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit short on budget. I'm willing to pay $160 for the product.
I can see you're really interested in the product, but I'm not willing to go as low as $160. I'm willing to compromise and meet you at $175. It's a great price for a product that I know you'll love.
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but $175 is still a bit high for me. I'm willing to pay $165 for the product.

I'm starting to think we're getting close to a deal. I'm willing to meet you at $170, but that's as low as I'm willing to go. It's a great price for a product that I know you'll love, and I'm confident you won't find a better deal anywhere else.
I'm getting close to the price I'm willing to pay, but $170 is still a bit high for me. I'm willing to pay $165 for the product, and that's my final offer.

I've made it clear that $170 is my limit, and I'm not willing to go any lower. I'm going to stick with my previous offer of $170. If you're not willing to meet me at that price, I'm afraid I'll have to consider other options.
